Obsolete C++ functionality

The library contains features that can be replaced by C++11 analogs.

Some of these features are injected to namespace std. To prevent accidental linkage with other implementations of these C++ library features, the library defines the identifiers in other namespaces and injects them into namespace std::.  This way the “mangled name” seen by the linker will differ from the “mangled name” generated by other implementations.

Parent topic: Deprecated features
  • atomic Template Class
  • Exceptions
  • Mutexes
  • flow::tuple Template Class
  • critical_section
  • tbb_hash Class
  • tbb_thread Class
  • Threads
  • C++11 Synchronization
